alert.note: Alert for Coastal Jefferson; Lower Jefferson; Lower Lafourche; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lafourche and central Jefferson Parishes through 1245 PM CDT... At 1209 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing tropical funnel clouds 8 miles northeast of Cut Off, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tropical funnel clouds and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cut Off and Lafitte. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief tropical funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Jefferson; Lower Jefferson; Lower Lafourche; Upper Lafourche
